references.paper_title: Algorithmic Learning in a Random World
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational theory of conformal prediction, which is the core methodology used in this paper.

references.paper_title: Uncertainty sets for image classifiers using conformal prediction
references.reason: This paper extends conformal prediction to image classification, providing a relevant baseline for comparison and a potential area of application of the SNAPS algorithm.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This is a seminal paper in graph neural networks, and the proposed method is built upon GCNs, making this a crucial foundational reference.

references.paper_title: Classification with valid and adaptive coverage
references.reason: This paper introduces adaptive prediction sets (APS), a key nonconformity score method used and analyzed in this paper, which is a fundamental building block of the proposed approach.

references.paper_title: Conformal prediction sets for graph neural networks
references.reason: This is the most directly related work, introducing a previous method (DAPS) for efficient conformal prediction in GNNs, offering a direct point of comparison for the proposed SNAPS algorithm.
